snippet: What seems to have touched off the church’s latest hard-line stance is a long-running dispute over the position of women.
abstract: Op-Ed article by journalist Cadence Woodland maintains the Mormon Church's crackdown on progressive, dissenting voices marks the end of a period of openness that began with Mitt Romney's presidential campaign; expresses disappointment that those who advocate expanded rights for gays and women within church have been marginalized or threatened with expulsion; warns church will continue to lose members and relevancy until it embraces diversity.
lead_paragraph: What seems to have touched off the church’s latest hard-line stance is a long-running dispute over the position of women.

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
keywords.name: subject
